# drawHashMarksAndLabels(in:)

**Instance Method**

Draws the receiver’s hash marks and labels in `aRect`, which is expressed in the receiver’s coordinate system.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func drawHashMarksAndLabels(in rect: NSRect)
```

## Discussion

This method is invoked by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRulerMarker/draw(_:)]—you should never need to invoke it directly. You can define custom measurement units using the class method [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRulerView/registerUnit(withName:abbreviation:unitToPointsConversionFactor:stepUpCycle:stepDownCycle:)]. Override this method if you want to customize the appearance of the hash marks themselves.

## Drawing

- **drawMarkers(in:)**: Draws the receiver’s markers in `aRect`, which is expressed in the receiver’s coordinate system.
- **invalidateHashMarks()**: Forces recalculation of the hash mark spacing for the next time the receiver is displayed.
